body_html:
@jubjamie Thanks for looking into this! Were you also running with version 1.0.1?

@aselle @IgorX2 TensorBoard is expected to work on Windows, although there are some wrinkles around (e.g.) TensorBoard options that are colon-delimited and get confused by Windows paths. Seeing the full command, as @jubjamie suggests, would help to diagnose this.

body:
@jubjamie Thanks for looking into this! Were you also running with version 1.0.1?

@aselle @IgorX2 TensorBoard is expected to work on Windows, although there are some wrinkles around (e.g.) TensorBoard options that are colon-delimited and get confused by Windows paths. Seeing the full command, as @jubjamie suggests, would help to diagnose this.
